subject: Data
title: Your Digital Footprint: Data You Leave Behind
description: A fast breakdown of Your Digital Footprint: Data You Leave Behind for builders.

hook.text: Every website you visit, every search you make, and every purchase you complete leaves a data trail.

buildup.text: Your digital footprint includes cookies, browsing history, location data, app usage, and social interactions.

discovery.text: Companies combine these traces to build detailed profiles â€” your interests, habits, health, and finances.

twist.text: Even 'deleted' data persists. Backups, caches, and third-party copies make digital erasure nearly impossible.

climax.text: Understanding your digital footprint is the first step to controlling how much of your life is data.

punchline.text: You don't use the internet for free. You pay with your data.

quiz.question: Why is 'deleting' data not truly permanent?
options: Backups, caches, and third-party copies preserve data
